feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued November 12 at 9:32AM AKST until November 13 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO NOON AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 9 inches with up to 12 inches on the Anchorage and Eagle River Hillsides. Areas of blowing snow reducing visibilities to one half mile or less at times Monday morning.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 12 at 4:42AM AKST until November 13 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 6 AM AKST MONDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Ice accumulations of a trace up to a tenth of an inch.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 4:22AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...FRONTAL SYSTEM TO BRING TRANSITIONS BETWEEN SNOW, RAIN, AND FREEZING RAIN TODAY... A front will begin to push inland across Southwest Alaska this morning bringing with it warmer air. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 2:54AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Confidence Continues to Increase for Snowfall Sunday Night through Thursday... A strong frontal boundary is expected to bring snowy conditions for most of the Interior Sunday night and into Monday. Widespread snowfall of 2 to 5 inches possible with locally heavier amounts of 5 to 7 inches west of Fairbanks through Tuesday. Gusty west winds

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 2:52AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Water Levels Expected Monday Through Tuesday... A strong storm moving through the Chukchi Sea Sunday into Monday will push a surge of water into the northwest Arctic Coast.
